nodes.bodyText: do we need this?
Why does this need a magic-number width instead of 100% or something?

I was going off of the model of input widths dictating most of the page width here. For the previous page, because there needs to be content on the left and right, it was important to set some fixed width, so the content doesn't fall in a weird way.
In many ways, this is all relative to input sizing.
Should this be configured per-environment?
This is a test. So it is just for the sake of the tests here. It is configured per env in live code.
Why the absolute height and width?

This is a container for text, so it all is relative to text sizing here. This page is going to be a lot more on absolute height and width I think, because of the nature of it being a pretty heavy weight form. (This one is probably the most changeable to percentages, but in general I wanted to stick with the theme of the page.)
another absolute height
This is absolute based on the inputs, essentially 2x input + 2rem padding.
empty string should be falsey so you shouldn't need the second half of the &&
Empty string is falsy, but [] is truthy. This is an array not a string.
Why do we do this instead of a *Required and starring required fields, which is a much more widely used indicator of what is required and what is not?
